name: Pale Sneaker of Doom: Rogue 24 / Bard 6 / Pale Master 10
author: KailPendragon

posts.author: KailPendragon
posts.content:
I'm reposting one of my all time favorite builds, a nasty halfling of doom of great character also in light of me publishing his "cousin" the Paler Sneaker of Doom. Updated to be 1.69 compliant. Enjoy.

Original discussion here



******************************



We've got an Epic Dodger, Self Concealment V halfling dexer here, with a wide skill selection (Rogue+Bard); actually it's so wide that skillpoints ain't enough (not that they ever are enough to me). Taunt is a nice addition that will help vs spellcasters (better saves and spell failure chance) and melee types alike (lowering their AC). A 6th lvl Bard Song is there to help a little too. Epic trap skills are in and so is a high Search and a working OL. Points can be traded to Spellcraft if one wants some extra help vs spells.

Considered the high AC, ED, SC V, Crit immunity, IE and high Ref save you are going to be quite hard to damage. Damage output is excellent when sneaks fire and can be made decent thanks to UMD vs crit/sneak immunes. Crippling Strike is in to make this little fella an even nastier Doom machine.

KD/IKD are missing. IC is missing too, but that’s no big deal at all IMO with a sneaker with this amount of sneak attacks. EP and AS are missing. This little guy’s tight on feats. HPs are low: one could lower STR to 8 and pump CON to 14 if the loss of carrying capacity ain't gonna be an issue. Leveling up, as all dexers, is gonna be harder than with a STR build but not incredibly so.

Little Deathless Sniper /Rogue 24/Bard 6/Palemaster 10 by Jennalee goes with the same lvl split but does't aim for SC V and her halfling's a sniper (dards are the chosen weapon), doesn't get CS, does not dual wield and has a lower AB.

posts.author: Maximillian Kane
posts.content: I gotta tell you I prefer his cousin, and by a LOT. Wasting all these feats to get undispellable concealment being that you can use scrolls and dusts, and also all that you're giving up both in spread optimization (19/5/16 is MUCH better) and epic feats is just not cost effective. Epic Mage Armor + Armor Skin + 2 more Bone Skin increases give you +11 AC, Epic Prowess gives +1 to AB and with 19 Rogue levels you can still get Crippling Strike. The only downside is that the way I just suggested, the epic spells would be delayed, cuz you either take PM levels or Rogue levels. Personally, I'd go for ED first, then EMA, then EW.

posts.author: KailPendragon
posts.content:
The thing with SCV is that it is, in a generic middle magic environment with ordinary access to II, not cost effective, we all know it. At the same time this one is a theme build centered on having SCV together with ED and crit immunity plus high AC, so SCV is a must here by definition (in some environments it might even be the way to go because lack of access to improved invisibility). And so here we go.

Added the link to the original discussion of the build.
